column1: Table SX. Karyotypic position of human chromosomes 21 (HSA21) and 22 (HSA22) in 123 placental mammal genomes determined by Zoo-FISH (O'Brien, Perelman, & Graphodatsky, 2020). n(AUT) refers to the haploid number of autosomes in the karyotype. Red values indicate the HSA21 or HSA22 segments are located in a telomeric or distal chromosome arm position, or on one of the smallest chromosomes (smallest 25%) in the karyotype (also underlined). 22a and 22b refer to the two separate syntenic segments that comprise a single chromosome in humans (HSA22) and all other anthropoid primates, but are on two chromosomes (normally fused with separate fragments of HSA 12) in the majority of placental mammals and the ancestral placental mammal karyotype (Murphy et al. 2001, Graphodatsky et al. 200X). define dist prox tel
